item.title: 贝森特称欧盟在贸易问题上可能存在 "集体行动问题
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）淡化了与欧盟迅速达成贸易协定的可能性，称欧盟存在 "集体行动问题"，阻碍了谈判。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed the possibility of a quick trade agreement with the European Union, saying the bloc suffers from a “collective action problem” that’s hampering negotiations.】

item.title: 软银利润跃升得益于人工智能复原力的提升
item.description: 软银集团公司（SoftBank Group Corp. ）公布的季度财报显示，该公司实现了季度盈利，原因是人工智能需求的恢复性增长支撑了初创企业的估值和芯片销售，这也推动了该公司积极的数据中心投资计划。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. reported a quarterly profit on resilient AI demand that’s supporting startup valuations and chip unit sales, a boost to its aggressive data center investment plans.】

item.title: 塞内加尔瓦锡兰电力项目开始油改气工程
item.description: 塞内加尔在上个月出口了第一批液化天然气燃料后，开始改造一座发电厂，使其使用液化天然气。【原文：Senegal began converting a power plant to operate on liquefied natural gas, after exporting its first consignment of the fuel last month.】

item.title: 富兰克林称海湾地区股票将在新兴市场指数中发挥更大作用
item.description: 富兰克林邓普顿表示，由于该地区的 "深刻变革"，海湾地区证券交易所的股票在基准新兴市场股票指数中的比例将增加近一半。【原文：The representation of shares from Gulf stock exchanges in the benchmark emerging-market equity index is set to rise by almost half because of the region’s “profound transformation,” Franklin Templeton said.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚通胀持平，政治风险为前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 罗马尼亚上个月的通货膨胀率保持不变，共产主义解体以来最严重的政治危机将列伊汇率推至历史新低，这可能会加剧物价压力，并使央行下个月货币政策的观望态度复杂化。【原文：Romanian inflation remained unchanged last month as the gravest political crisis since the collapse of communism pushed the leu to a record low which will likely intensify price pressure and complicate the central bank’s wait-and-see approach to monetary policy in the coming month.】

item.title: 英国企业因增税和贸易战影响连续第三个月裁员
item.description: 由于260亿英镑（340亿美元）的增税政策生效，以及唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策使全球经济前景黯淡，英国企业在4月份连续第三个月裁员。【原文：British businesses cut jobs for a third straight month in April as a £26 billion ($34 billion) tax hike took effect and Donald Trump’s tariffs darkened the global economic outlook.】

item.title: 印度首次针对特朗普关税制度提出反制措施
item.description: 印度提议对部分美国商品征收关税，以回应华盛顿对钢铁和铝征收的关税，这标志着印度首次对唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税制度采取报复行动，尽管两国距离最终达成贸易协议已越来越近。【原文：India has proposed levies on some US goods in response to Washington’s duties on steel and aluminum, marking its first retaliation against President Donald Trump’s tariff regime, even as the two countries move closer to finalizing a trade deal.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市有望在反弹后下挫，英镑走高
拜耳因癌症和肾脏新药收益超预期
item.description: 拜耳公司第一季度的盈利降幅低于预期，原因是对癌症和肾脏新药的强劲需求帮助抵消了农产品销售的下滑。【原文：Bayer AG’s earnings fell less than expected in the first quarter as robust demand for its new cancer and kidney medicines helped offset a decline in agricultural sales.】

item.title: 埃克萨罗煤矿公司将以 6.4 亿美元收购锰矿资产
item.description: 南非最大的煤矿商埃克萨罗资源有限公司（Exxaro Resources Ltd.）已同意以约 116.7 亿兰特（6.4 亿美元）的价格收购南非最大的锰矿。【原文：Exxaro Resources Ltd., South Africa’s biggest coal miner, has agreed to acquire the nation’s largest manganese mines for about 11.67 billion rand ($640 million).】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火造成 11 亿欧元损失，慕尼黑再保险公司利润减半
item.description: 慕尼黑再保险公司（Munich Re）第一季度利润下滑了近一半，原因是肆虐大洛杉矶地区的野火造成的损失影响了盈利。【原文：Munich Re’s first-quarter profit slumped by almost half as losses from wildfires that ravaged swaths of the greater Los Angeles area weighed on earnings.】

item.title: 美国贸易休战后中国取消波音飞机交付禁令
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在与美国的贸易谈判取得突破性进展，双方都暂时削减了关税之后，中国已经取消了对航空公司接收波音公司飞机长达一个月的禁令。【原文：China has removed a month-long ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing Co. planes, according to people familiar with the matter, following a breakthrough in trade talks with the US that temporarily slashed tariffs on each side.】

item.title: 这些就是梦想的关税
item.description:
中美不打贸易战的前景为自1990年以来最伟大的反弹之一画上了句号。【原文：

The prospect of no US-China trade war is capping one of the greatest rallies since 1990. 

】

item.title: 欧洲复兴开发银行称斯洛伐克和匈牙利受关税影响最严重
item.description: 据欧洲复兴开发银行称，东欧国家预计将成为受贸易关税相关风险打击最严重的经济体之一。【原文：Eastern European countries are expected to be among the economies worst hit by risks related to trade tariffs, according to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.】

item.title: 中美关税降级，交易员削减澳央行宽松押注
item.description: 在中美两国同意暂时降低彼此产品关税的连带效应下，交易员们正在逐步减少对澳大利亚采取激进宽松货币政策的押注。【原文：Traders are winding back bets on aggressive monetary easing by Australia in a cascading effect from the US and China agreeing to temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products.】

item.title: 迪拜酋长价值 4.87 亿美元的房地产投资信托上市在几分钟内售罄
item.description: 迪拜控股公司在其高达 18 亿迪拉姆（约合 4.87 亿美元）的房地产投资信托基金上市中，所有发售单位都受到追捧，该公司旨在利用迪拜蓬勃发展的房地产市场。【原文：Dubai Holding had demand for all units on offer in its up to 1.8 billion dirhams ($487 million) listing of a real estate investment trust, aiming to capitalize on the city’s booming property market.】

item.title: 贸易停战令刺激经济的希望破灭，中国股市下滑
item.description: 中国股市周二在香港下跌，原因是与美国达成的关税休战协议带来的最初乐观情绪，让人们开始担心中国政府不会急于加大刺激经济增长的力度。【原文：Chinese stocks fell in Hong Kong on Tuesday, as initial optimism from the tariff truce with the US gave way to concerns that Beijing won’t feel the need to urgently ramp up growth stimulus.】

item.title: 特朗普从沙特王子手中赢得 2 万亿美元资金面临障碍
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普希望从沙特阿拉伯获得多达 1 万亿美元的投资承诺，这可能会与另一个代价高昂的雄心--改造沙特王国自身的经济--发生冲突。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s hopes of securing as much as $1 trillion in investment commitments from Saudi Arabia might clash with another costly ambition - transforming the kingdom’s own economy.】

item.title: 美国石油产量已达顶峰。但不要指望会迅速下降。
item.description:
没有任何迹象表明 2020 年的暴跌即将重演。【原文：

Nothing suggests that a repetition of 2020’s plunge is imminent. 

】

item.title: 谷歌在欧洲面临至少 120 亿欧元的民事索赔
item.description:
这家科技巨头因其购物搜索服务被欧盟处以 24 亿欧元的罚款。据称受害者提起的诉讼可能会增加数十亿美元。【原文：

The tech giant was hit with a €2.4 billion fine in the EU over its shopping search service. Suits from alleged victims could add billions more.

】

item.title: Indeed 数据显示外国人对美国招聘信息的兴趣下降
item.description: 科维德-19疫情爆发后，外国对美国工作岗位的兴趣几乎消失殆尽，这种转变有可能加剧医疗保健等行业的劳动力短缺。【原文：The burst of foreign interest in US jobs following the Covid-19 pandemic has all but vanished, a shift that threatens to exacerbate labor shortages in industries such as health care.】

item.title: 中国稀土企业要求美国官方澄清出口问题
item.description: 在北京和华盛顿就贸易战达成停火协议后，中国稀土出口商要求美国政府澄清是否允许他们向美国销售稀土。【原文：Chinese rare-earth exporters are asking the government to clarify whether they’re allowed to sell to the US, after Beijing and Washington called a ceasefire in their trade war.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦停战，卢比上涨，节后恢复交易
item.description: 印度与巴基斯坦达成停火协议，引发当地股市大涨，印度卢比在长周末后恢复交易，创下近两周来最大涨幅。【原文：The Indian rupee rallied the most in nearly two weeks as trading resumed after a long weekend, supported by a ceasefire agreement with Pakistan that triggered a surge in local stocks.】

item.title: 高盛上调 S&P 500 指数目标，因关税下调和经济衰退风险
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. lifted its US stock targets, as the easing of trade tensions between the US and China fuels a comeback of the “Buy America” trade.】

item.title: 特朗普关税施压，习近平向拉美示好
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平誓言要深化与拉美和加勒比国家的经济合作，并向一些国家提供免签证入境待遇，他试图将中国定位为比美国更好的合作伙伴。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to deepen economic cooperation with Latin American and Caribbean nations and offered visa-free entry to some countries, as he seeks to position China as a better partner than the US.】

item.title: 空头成本创新低，助推港元下滑
item.description: 随着港元疲软至其固定交易区间的中间位置，做空港元的成本已降至历史最低点。【原文：The cost of shorting the Hong Kong dollar has slumped to an all-time low, as the currency weakens to the middle of its fixed trading band.】

item.title: 中国美团将以 10 亿美元预算启动巴西业务
item.description: 路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）希望在中国的帮助下改变巴西依赖大宗商品的经济，美团将在五年内投资 10 亿美元，在巴西启动并扩大食品配送服务。【原文：Meituan will invest $1 billion over five years to start and expand a food delivery service in Brazil, as Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva hopes to transform the country’s commodities-reliant economy with help from China.】

item.title: 贸易提振后铁矿石重拾跌势，前景充满挑战
item.description: 随着中美贸易休战带来的风险升温逐渐消退，铁矿石价格下跌，交易商将注意力重新转向充满挑战的行业背景。【原文：Iron ore fell as a broad, risk-on lift that followed the US-China trade truce faded, with traders turning their attention back to a challenging industry backdrop.】

item.title: Vinpearl 股票在越南首次交易中以限价大涨
item.description: Vinpearl JSC 的股票在首次交易中以最高价跃升，这家越南最大商业帝国的酒店部门成为越南最大的上市公司之一。【原文：Shares of Vinpearl JSC jumped by the limit in their trading debut as the hospitality unit of Vietnam’s largest business empire became one of the country’s biggest listed companies.】

item.title: 摘要显示日本央行在警惕关税的同时仍着眼于加息
item.description: 根据日本央行 4 月 30 日至 5 月 1 日会议的意见摘要，日本央行董事会成员表示有意进一步加息，同时表示需要对美国关税措施的潜在经济影响保持警惕。【原文：Bank of Japan board members signaled their intention for further rate hikes while citing the need to stay vigilant due the potential economic impacts from US tariff measures, according to a summary of opinions from their April 30-May 1 meeting.】
